title: Android Software Developer (Contract)
description:
We’re always looking for passionate software developers to contract with us on projects. Our current preferences for a contract developer include:
Native Android development experience (Java and/or Kotlin)
Located in the Seattle, WA area
Here’s a more general description of what you’ll do and the basic requirements for joining us under any contract:

As a Developer, you'll be contributing to the successful delivery of digital products. You articulate the objective rationale behind your coding decisions, working with your teammates to ensure those align with business and audience needs. You'll be switching between setting direction, creating software, and helping your teams constantly improve. You handle it with ease through solid time management skills, enthusiastic client services, and an inspiring attitude. You thoughtfully apply the latest tools, trends, and practices of the development alongside those that are more tried-and-true.

In your day-to-day you will:
Collaborate with your project team to evaluate a product experience holistically, identify next steps and deliver the individual features that make up the product
Objectively explain and represent your contributions and deliverables to your team and client
Clearly communicate with your project team to make sure they have full context of your work and that you have the same of theirs, jumping in on other tasks as needed
Take on various tasks, development-related or not, to support different processes and needs on your project teams
Collaborate directly every day with designers, developers, engagement managers, and clients
Requirements

You are an ambitious developer

You don't believe in resting on your laurels and easily tackle situations of ambiguity to figure out how to keep yourself and your work moving forward.

You are a collaborative project contributor

You work together with your project team to understand, act, and deliver on next steps translated from product and client needs.

You are an adaptive contributor

You're eager to jump in on tasks to support your team as needed, with no ego or complaints.

You are a student of business and development practices

You want to constantly improve client service, business, and software development practices in yourself and your team.

Experience
3+ years of software development experience (ideally w/experience in a client services or agency environment)
Proficiency w/i development (ex. primarily Java and Kotlin, but Xamarin, React Native, etc. are also nice-to-haves)
Strong communication, client services, and interpersonal skills
Fierce passion about collaboration and the way you develop software
Understanding of integrated development practices and experience directly collaborating with design teams
Experience or familiarity solving problems across multiple technology platforms (eg. browsers, applications, operating systems, mobile and connected devices, other hardware)
(Preferred) Demonstrated practice w/test-driven/behavior-driven product development

title: Software Developer - Instrumentation
description:
Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play.

SUMMARY

We are seeking a Software Developer to join our growing team. The Product Instrumentation team is responsible for improving the accuracy, consistency, and utility of data reported from Hulu's client applications. Your work will streamline how Hulu tracks user behavior data, allowing Hulu to develop the right products and features and make the right business decisions. On this team, you could write code for the Hulu Android application one day and the next day you could work on a service that tests data quality for billions of data points. Does the idea of working across all aspects and teams of Hulu interest you? Do you love learning something new every single day? If you are the curious type who loves collaborating, then this is an excellent role for you.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Design and build the next generation instrumentation platform
Maintain instrumentation SDKs for different devices and web applications
Work with teams across the Hulu tech stack to integrate instrumentation services and SDKs into their applications and services
Work with our partners to define instrumentation specifications
WHAT TO BRING
3+ years of software development experience
2+ years of experience writing JavaScript or TypeScript
Experience building NodeJS/Express services
A real passion for test-driven development
A strong grasp of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.)
Great communication and teamwork skills
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
NICE-TO-HAVES
Experience with open-source datastores like Redis, MySQL, Couchbase, or Hive
Experience building web UIs with React
Experience using other consumer analytics tools like Google Analytics or Tealium
Familiar with data profiling tools and data quality practices
Experience with mobile and living room device development

title: Web Software Developer (Python/React)
description:
The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technology leader. Walts passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the worlda passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from: animation, theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences and were constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences. Part of the Disney ABC Television Group, Disney Television Animation is a high capacity digital animation television production studio. Because of Disney Television Animations strong use of commercial and custom software technologies to create its animation products, its use of technology, engineering, development techniques and software is critical to its production operations and workflows.

The Web Software Developer is responsible for designing and developing web based code/software solutions and maintaining existing web based code/software for the Disney Television Animation business unit.

Responsibilities :
A high level breakdown of the Web Software Developers responsibilities follows:
Interacting with departmental and production staff as required
Analyzing production software procedures and problems
Evaluating the effectiveness of existing software solutions
Assist with identifying opportunities to improve: production software output, efficiency, and workflow
Software analysis and design
Code testing / integration
High level support of developed code
The Web Software Developer partners with the technology departments management, department staff and production personnel to determine software engineering needs. Additionally, the WBSD reviews existing software system capabilities to decide what changes can be made within existing systems and when new systems must be added to provide solutions - whichever meets productions need in the timeliest manner and fits within the specific budget.

The Web Software Developer is responsive to our environments critical production timelines and is able to analyze bugs/ system glitches, track them to the corrupted code, implement timely repairs, and make recommendations for avoiding similar situations via code/software/system changes and code management procedures.

Basic Qualifications :
2 years + (or a combination of work experience and advanced education) working in a web based software development environment with a demonstrated competency in delivering advanced software applications and solutions.
A portfolio of demonstrated web based solutions.
Must be able to work independently with technical and non-technical staff to determine web based system design, modification and support needs.
Strong written documentation skills and possess creativity in developing easy-to-use tools and quick fixes.
Must be experienced, understanding a range of development languages / platforms and operating systems:
Experience working with backend frameworks in Python, PHP, or NodeJS
Experience working with frontend libraries: React, Vue or Angular
Experience working in a TDD, BDD or another unit testing driven environment
Experience developing with Docker
Experience designing RESTful APIs
Experience with databases: MySQL, Redis, etc.
Experience with version control: Git
Familiarity with web servers: Apache, Nginx, etc.
Familiarity with Cloud Providers (AWS, Azure or GCP)
Familiarity with common Software Engineering Design Patterns
Mobile development experience is a plus but not required
Experience working with networking environments.
Able to communicate technical information effectively both written and verbally.
Ability to strategically solve complex technical issues.
Ability to work in a fast paced, production critical environment.
Must be well organized and detailed oriented.
Required Education :
Bachelors degree in a technical discipline.

About Disney Television Animation:

Disney Television Animation loves characters. Characters reveal our deepest emotions and what it means to be human… even if you're an animated duck, mouse, muppet, lion, boy or girl. Are you the type of character that loves animation and wants to be part of the team that makes the magic happen? Disney Television Animation, an integral part of The Walt Disney Company, creates many of the company's most beloved animated shows. If you've got a passion to join our team of talented professionals, we want to hear your story.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Pictures, which is part of a business segment we call Disney Television Animation.

title: Software Developer - Entry Level
description:
Job Description

We are looking for talented graduates who are hungry to be challenged and grow their skill sets. While we have been in business since 2001, we are still a young company with great growth potential and opportunity as our market and client-base expands. We need customer service oriented software developers who are leaders, problem solvers, and high achievers that go above and beyond simple project requirements.

Our software developers are asked to work on a myriad of projects with varying due dates and deadlines. These projects range in complexity and encompass internal tools, custom incentive programs for clients, new feature functionality for our core product or ancillary products, the re-architecture of our core product and other items.

As such, our developers work in all facets of the application architecture (full stack) and are eager to utilize whatever technology is necessary to get the job done efficiently and accurately. Additionally, our developers must have the ability to think on their feet and be cognizant of the bigger picture. Initiative and problem-solving skills are a must.

Developers who thrive in our environment think beyond the project requirements and deliver projects with consideration for their team, the overall customer experience, and future of our product.

We need individuals who:
Can code
Are positive team players
Willing to get their hands dirty within some older technologies
Willing to get their hands dirty working with newer technologies
Are great communicators

Are excited to solve problems and want to help a young company grow

title: Software Developer
description:
Job Description:
Design, develop and test in-house proprietary solutions for Web Service and Data Exchange Services using Cold Fusion among other technologies such as NodeJS, React etc. Detailed job duties include: Create and maintain documentations necessary such as Technical Design Specifications, Test Cases and Test Results through the course of the project; Participate in team design sessions and code reviews; Execute test cases, and create a log of defects discovered during testing ; Participate in Sprint Planning, Daily Stand Up, and Retrospective; Understand and apply Object Oriented Analysis and Design principles and of N-tier application architecture, and software design patterns as necessary. Ensure application development deliverables are completed on time.

Minimum job requirement:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field and at least three years of experience. Will accept Bachelor’s degree and five years of experience in lieu of Master’s degree and three years of experience. Must have experience in software development using the following: VB.Net, Oracle , Microsoft SQL Server, SOAP Web service , RESTful API, JavaScript , Node JS , React, JQuery, Bootstrap, CSS, HTML, JSON.

title: Software Developer
description:
C2FO is looking for software engineers with a variety of experience including entry level.

Our Software Engineers are at the forefront of how customers interact with C2FO. Working with our product team, we create applications for both internal and external customers. Our philosophy: short iterations with a focus on scalability while ensuring maintainability.

Day in the life of a software engineer at C2FO

Daily
Plan for the week with your team on Monday during sprint planning meetings or weekly check-in meetings. We do two-week sprints.
Stay up-to-date with the company and interesting people in KC during the company all-hands meeting.
Give and receive feedback on your teams code by reviewing pull requests on Github.
On any day pick up a task from the Jira sprint board, get in the zone and code.
Enjoy catered lunch from that days local restaurant (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday).
Afternoons can vary depending upon features; typically they are made up of coding.
After work, hang out and play board games, enjoy camaraderie, shoot pool, or play some ping pong.
Periodically
Review or create RFCs (request for comments) for technical debt or changes that may impact your team or other teams.
Discuss UI/UX designs for up-coming features with our designers.
Discuss technical designs with your team during a design document walkthrough.
Break down project details with our Product Managers.
Our Tech Stack(Not a list of requirements)
Angular, React.js, Ember.js, Sass
Rest and GraphQL APIs built in Node.js and Kotlin
PostgreSQL (AWS RDS)
Scala
Kubernetes for our Cloud infrastructure
AWS and GCP
Docker
Standard Benefits
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Generous health benefits
401K plan (with employer match)
Performance bonus
Tuition reimbursement
Opportunity to earn equity in the company
Extraordinary Benefits
Our culture of trust allows employees to get their work done with an unlimited amount of PTO.
Work from home if you have a sick child, dog, cat, or chameleon. Come in late if youre having a package delivered. We support flexible schedules so our employees can achieve their best possible work.
Cant work on an empty stomach; we have a stocked kitchen with snacks & drinks.
Get a taste of Kansas City with catered lunch 3 days a week from a variety of local restaurants.
Travel with your teammates to 2 conferences a year! AWS re: Invent, JSConf, React Conf, RustConf or your choice, we support our employee's desire to stay educated.
Enjoy a fun atmosphere with our company outings to Sporting KC, Royals, Axe Throwing, Pickleball...etc
About C2FO

C2FO is the largest non-bank provider of working capital to businesses. Weve also been recognized by Forbes Fintech 50 and are on track to become the first financial unicorn company in the state of Kansas.

Our technology provides hundreds of thousands of businesses of all sizes (suppliers) an easy, low-cost way to improve cash flow through early invoice payments, while at the same time helping Fortune 500 companies (buyers) achieve far better returns on short-term cash than any other investment vehicle available.

We also provide our network of businesses access to the lowest cost and most convenient capital sources through receivables finance, which includes asset-based lending and factoring.

C2FO is headquartered in Kansas City, USA and backed by leading venture capital firms including Temasek, Tiger Global, Union Square Ventures & Mithril.

title: Software Developer - Analytics Platforms
description:
Software Developer - Analytics Platforms
We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as a tech startup within a Fortune 100 company, we are leading a digital disruption that will redefine how people experience insurance.
About the job:
We are seeking an experienced, motivated Software Developer with Full Stack skills, to participate in software development within an Agile team supporting our Analytic Platforms and Services department. You will be working on our existing analytics application, Cortex. This is an internally developed Java application that is intended to allow analytics teams to quickly create, manage and terminate their own scalable high-performance cloud computing and storage environments to support analytics, machine learning and big data projects.
Cortex includes a provisioning service that works with both AWS and Azure, a tools portal that allows users to work with popular data science tools like R and Python, a fully compliant security layer, and several utilities that make it easy to stage data science problems with Cortex. The Cortex team also works directly with Liberty data science teams in all markets to assist them with their projects and gather new requirements and insights to support the ongoing development of the platform.
The industry changes quickly, so we are looking for candidates who can respond to change, pick up new technologies quickly and adapt to changing requirements. We also want candidates who take pride in their work and have strong design and development expertise. We value quality code delivery and expect candidates to demonstrate competence at writing, testing and debugging Java code.
Desired skills:
Generally 2+ years of professional development experience in Java.
Experience with Full Stack Development including HTML, JavaScript, React and Angular
Knowledge in web service development, design and specifications writing with SOAP or REST.
Foundational knowledge or proficient in new and emerging technologies such as AWS, Azure and Cloud, DevOps, CI/CD and MicroServices.
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and communication and collaboration skills.
General knowledge of agile software development concepts and processes.
Must be proactive, demonstrate initiative and be a logical thinker.
Experience with layered system architectures and layered solutions; understanding of shared software concepts.

Python

R Language

Generally 2+ years of professional development experience

Analytical, problem solving, and communication skills
Experience with layered system architectures and layered solutions; understanding of shared software concepts
Extensive knowledge of IT concepts, strategies and methodologies.
Extensive knowledge of a business function(s) and of business operations. Extensive knowledge of design and development tools.

Proficient in multiple programming languages and tools.

title: Software Developer
description:
At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

We’re looking for the next generation of talented Software Developers to join our team. This is a unique opportunity for a newly qualified Software Engineering graduate, or an individual early in their career to work in a fast-paced exciting development team building applications that support the creation of content for our digital and mobile learning products.

Role Outline

The job is to work within the development team to deliver ground breaking technology services for both internal and external customers. The right person will further develop the skills required for a full-stack java and web developer and will gain knowledgeable in enterprise architecture principles, the integration of multiple APIs and systems, and how to support customers and integration partners in multiple timezones. Development will be in Node JS (server) and React JS(View). Through your work in our team you will build practical expertise in the following accountabilities:
Finding simple, elegant, powerful and pragmatic solutions to complex problems
Work according to devops principles, with full test automation and continuous integration and delivery, and using immutable infrastructure with Docker on AWS.
Experience with an object oriented programming language.
Javascript skills - Node.js or React experience is great
Day to Day Functions:

Under the direction of Platform Director and Technical Lead you will:
Work with offshore and onshore development teams to understand, develop and continuously improve platform designs
Take responsibility for the quality of your code / integration work delivered
Ensure the highest development standards are followed
Coordinate with testing team to support test activities
Actively challenge and refine design and delivery based on experience and domain knowledge; additionally seek peers reviews with external (non-project related) resources to validate approach
Key Challenges:
Working with a number of stakeholders and business units within Pearson, and across multiple timezones and cultures
Fast paced environment, looking to deliver truly transformative technology against challenging timescales

Skills & Qualifications
BS in Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, or related disciplines.
Hands on engineering experience in either modern Javascript frameworks (React.js, Angular, Ember, etc.) or client-side languages (Java, Node, etc.)
Familiarity with Single-page web application development, using JavaScript frameworks, HTML5 and CSS.
Interest in developer productivity
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication skills
Ability to work both independently and in groups, including widely distributed team members in a global enterprise
Ability to prioritize and set goals on shifting priorities
#LI-LL

title: Independent Software Developer
description:
Software Engineer Needs Description

LHBA/BTS

Need: Software Developer experienced in React, Node, Typescript, Postgres

Reports to: BTS Executive Team

Needs Description

Basketball Training Systems (BTS) www.basketballtrainingsystems.comimplements youth basketball programs around the country, a number of which are for NBA players.In our licensee facilities we use state of the art athlete tracking technology used by a number of NBA teams.The technology comes primarily from Kinexon Sports & Media Inc and RSPCT Basketball Technologies LTD; however BTS is intending to link data from Microsofts Lazer 9000 dribbling system and video technologies such as Pixelot and PlaySight in the future.BTS requires all of its vendors to open their APIs so that the information can be collected from each technology into a single repository for athletes using the systems.BTS has created something it calls its Digital Locker which allows athletes to retain and view their data anytime and anywhere.The DL is stored in AWS, and is built in React, Node, Typescript, and Postgres.

We are looking for an independent contract with whom we can grow the DL system.We anticipate this to be an ongoing project as we continue to add to and improve the experience in the DL; however, it does not currently warrant a full-time person.Consequently, we are looking for an independent contractor experienced in the above-languages that can be responsive, quick to get to solutions (note: this is customer facing and unexpected issues often needs quick turn-around time), able to articulate the time and costs of proposed improvements, manage to those expectations, and grow as we grow our DL members.

Role
Analyze athlete data gathered with Kinexon and RSPCT stored on AWS
Continue to build our Digital Locker user interface to
make the user interface easy and fun, and
expand the scope of data that we present to our members
Understand the principles of gamification and interface design to improve our technology platform
Collaborate with our staff to understand the Basketball Curriculum and its relationship to basketball technology.
Work to design new interfaces and implement them.
Address and troubleshoot technology issues as they occur
Database Design and administration
Skills
Computer programming skills, including React, Node, Typescript, Postgres
Digital Interface Design
Understand how to utilize tools in AWS
Data analysis & research
Must be able to articulate technology issues to other team members who do not have the same level of technical background
Must be able to organize a project into steps and report project status updates to executive team
Qualifications
Computer programming skills, including React, Node, Typescript, Postgres
High acumen for quantitative projects
Experience in data modeling, statistical analysis, and experiment design
Communication
Communicate often
Solicit regular feedback from staff regarding experience to improve DL tools
General
Effectively, professionally, and creatively project and present our organizations image and product offering to local community and beyond
Exceptional communication skills
A flexible and positive attitude

React: 2 years (Preferred)

English (Preferred)

title: Software Developer
description:
Stanford University\'s Department of Medicine,Division of Infectious Diseases is seeking a Software Developer to execute a range of programming tasks for the Stanford HIV Drug Resistance Database (HIVDB), including programming, analyzing, designing, developing, implementing, modifying, and maintaining computer programs. This is a key position in the laboratory of Dr. Robert Shafer to expand a widely used international resource. In this position, you will be one of three software developers working with a small group of clinical investigators and laboratory scientists. You will also be interacting with an international group of HIVDB users.

HIV drug resistance testing is increasingly used in clinical, research, and public health laboratories worldwide to assist in the management of the 20 million individuals receiving HIV therapy. HIVDB has had an outsized effect on HIV drug resistance research because it combines the expertise of a few individuals with software technologies that scale to handle large numbers of user-defined queries or sequences submitted for interpretation.

Creating a sustainable model that will scale with the expanding number of HIV drug therapy and drug resistance publications, will require novel approaches including text-mining, artificial intelligence, and crowd-sourcing. Your work will be instrumental in helping to transition HIVDB to a self-sustaining open resource for the community of clinicians, researchers, and public health laboratories that rely on the most up-to-date drug resistance data and knowledge.

Example responsibilities
Participating in redesigning the HIV Drug Resistance Database by migrating backend code from Perl to Python and by using object relational mappers such as SQLAlchemy.
Extending the HIV Drug Resistance Database schema towards a rich annotation of peer-reviewed publications whether or not the primary data from such publications are in the Database.
Developing forms to enable the online contribution and quality control analysis of primary data by the authors of published papers.
Improve our query pages to enable dynamic interactive data visualizations using JavaScipt libraries such as React, Relay, D3, and the GIS OpenLayers.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED)

Bachelor\'s degree and three years of relevant experience or a combination of education and relevant experience.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED)
Current knowledge of latest software and design standards.
Ability to define and solve logical problems for technical applications.
Knowledge of and ability to select, adapt, and effectively use a variety of programming methods.
Ability to recognize and recommend needed changes in user and/or operations procedures.
Basic knowledge of software engineering principles.
Strong knowledge of at least one programming language.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Masters degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or related field.
Interest in publication.
Experience with open-source / version control platforms.
Experience with Infrastructure as a Service such as AWS.
Excellent written communication skills.
Expert programming skills in Python or ability to rapidly develop these skills.
Experience at web development including HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience working with relational databases such as MySQL.
Experience with Perl or ability to understand Perl code.
Ability and desire to learn new skills.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*
Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.
Frequently sit, grasp lightly/fine manipulation.
Occasionally stand/walk, writing by hand.
Rarely use a telephone, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.
- Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS

May work extended hours, evening and weekends.

WORK STANDARDS
Interpersonal Skills Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promote Culture of Safety Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University\'s Administrative Guide, http//adminguide.stanford.edu.
Job Familynformation Technology Services
Job Series Software Developer

Exemption Exempt
Schedule Full-time

Additional Information
Schedule Full-time
Employee Status Regular
Requisition ID 78960

title: Software Developer - Jira Align
description:
Our mission at Jira Align is to Simplify Software at Scale by bringing business and software development organizations together in one intuitive platform. From executives trying to weigh one investment versus another to program managers looking to optimize development capacity, Jira Align has the expertise to help companies scale up and improve software delivery because finding solutions through agility is what we were born to do.

As a Software Engineer, you’ll be a key contributor to the Jira Align Development Platform which includes Core Jira Align product enhancements, REST API and all our integrations. Ideally you will be a Software Craftsman and agilest that will provide guidance and hands-on development of internal development, test, and continuous integration processes. We’re primarily a .NET shop that develops in client and server side scripting, C#, and ASP.NET with SQL Server as the database.

If you have strong technical background, experience working with the Microsoft Stack, REST APIs, understand the challenges of integrating multiple systems, and know how to manage your work using agile methodologies, we want to talk to you!

Responsibilities
Collaborate with customers, partners, and internal product leadership to understand requirements for enhancing our Core Product, REST API and integrations.
Work with on-shore and off-shore development teams to execute the stories in the backlog adhering to an agile process.
Development of APIs, integrations and Core Jira Align product development using .NET, C#, client and server side scripting, SQL Server, ADO.NET, ASP.NET Web API, and external system’s web services and SDKs.
Bring a QA mindset to your work, assisting the team with their continuous integration efforts using test and behavior driven development practices.
Support customers and partners in their usage of the development platform and integrations.
Requirements
3+ years development experience using the .NET stack.
Self-motivated with a “get it done” work ethic.
Ability to not get lost in “analysis paralysis”.
Ability to troubleshoot complex issues and provide timely solutions.
Proficient with front end languages including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks including Angular JS and React.
Experience with server side languages including VBScript.
Experience in designing/implementing RESTful web services
Proficient with MS-SQL database.

title: Software Developer II In Xbox Live
description:
Are you interested in working on extraordinary technical challenges, applied to the fun world of gaming? Do you want to work with a group of passionate, fun people on unleashing game developers and community creativity?

Xbox Live is the leading gamer network spanning console, PC and mobile games and is central to Microsoft’s gaming strategy; its services power the breadth of social gaming experiences with Xbox Live clubs, achievements, leaderboards, community hubs, game hubs, game activity feed, and much more. Xbox Live has an exemplary future as it expands to serve many more scenarios where consumers, and creators build each other.

Responsibilities
We are looking for a Software Development Engineer for the Xbox Live team who is creative, highly motivated, independent and innovative. You will need to be passionate about building experiences in the mobile, PC and web space while also building highly reliable, secure and scalable services that enable tens of millions of gamers to play online every day. Our bold charter is to build new, pioneering experiences on mobile, PC and web, and we need you to help us take that next step. You will be defining, prototyping and building new features, products and services. We will bring these innovations everywhere gamers are – PC, mobile, web, Xbox console and beyond.

You are uniquely positioned to deeply impact Xbox Live’s future and growth, gamers, and partner teams like Game Pass, Mixer and xCloud reach their goals.
Help us drive architecture, design, development of Xbox mobile and PC apps, and web experiences
Partner with game studios – internally and externally, client and service teams to enable groundbreaking new experiences
Collaborate with Xbox Live and partner organizations to support scenarios in gaming, social, security and more in the mobile, PC and web space.
Work with teams across to experiment their features on the mobile and PC app.
Self-motivated and comfortable taking care of the ambiguity of V1 and incubation work
Qualifications
What you'll need
3+ years in development shipping products and services
Strong technical capability, cross group teamwork and verbal interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and efficiently in a highly motivated team environment
To be adaptable and love dealing with ambiguity
At least a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, related discipline or equivalent experience
Bonus points
Proven ability to deliver high-quality end-to-end experiences for developers and consumers
Previous experience shipping mobile or pc apps. C++, iOS, Android, Java, Swift, Objective-C, Typescript, React, React Native, React XP, Electron.
Previous experience shipping large-scale cloud services and developer platforms. C#, .NET/.NET Core, Visual Studio, REST.

title: Software Developer II
description:
Power BI is a rising star at Microsoft that has rapidly disrupted and transformed the Business Intelligence market. We are looking for passionate web and full stack developers to create the next generation of BI experiences for Microsoft customers. Power BI is a modern interactive web app built on top of Azure, and the learning opportunities and are plentiful for the motivated individual. Come join us as we build the future of BI, analytics, and data insights.

Our users need a rich, immersive experience across the desktop, web, and mobile that helps them effortlessly gain insights and make sense of the immense amounts of data being generated by their businesses. As a Power BI developer, you'll help solve many interesting challenges in the areas of fluid animations, responsive layout, beautiful data visualizations, scalable services and easy to understand experiences. We use the latest web technologies and push the boundary on performance. We love open source, and are constantly looking for opportunities to increase customer value or team productivity by onboarding open source projects.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for technical planning, implementation, and monitoring of your feature usage, as well as assisting with customer requests and incidents that may arise. We work close as a team, often pairing up on feature development, and also working closely with program managers, UX designers, and partner product teams.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience
3+ years of industry experience working on commercial software applications or services
2 years of experience with C#, C++, Java, or TypeScript
2 years of experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

1 year of TypeScript
1 year of AngularJS/Angular/React or similar
1 year of git SCM

title: Software Developer

Overview

Walter P Moore is an international company of engineers, architects, innovators, and creative people who solve some of the world’s most complex structural and infrastructure challenges. Providing structural, diagnostics, civil, traffic, parking, transportation, enclosure, and construction engineering services, we design solutions that are cost- and resource-efficient, forward-thinking, and help support and shape communities worldwide. Founded in 1931 and headquartered in Houston, Texas, our 600+ professionals work across 20 U.S. offices and five international locations.

We are in need of a talented Software Developer to join our Houston, TX based software development team to create and maintain custom web based and windows based applications. The right person for this position will possess a strong can-do attitude and provide exceptional client service while using their analytical, problem-solving and project management skills.

1+ years web development experience (both MVC and Web Forms) C# on .NET Stack
1+ years of experience using Microsoft Visual Studio
Very strong communication skills
1+ years SQL/Relational database experience
1+ years JavaScript experience
1+ using css/bootstrap to create responsive web designs

description:
Overview

Are you passionate about creating good user experiences on the web? So are we! In the past few years, Esri has put a large effort into making design tools accessible and powerful for experts, stakeholders, and the public. We are dedicated to continually pushing the boundaries of GIS, and you can play a key role in our mission.

At Esri, we develop web applications based on our ArcGIS API for JavaScript. Join our team of exceptional software engineers to design and implement our next generation of web GIS applications, our JavaScript API, and our cloud solution ArcGIS Online.

Responsibilities:
Develop the UX/UI of a new suite of web apps
Conceptualize, design, implement, and test innovative user interface components on top of our JavaScript API
Work closely with JavaScript API software developers and product engineers in a highly interactive and creative environment
Interact with users to identify and articulate their needs
Research and apply state-of-the-art UX practices

Excellent JavaScript/HTML/CSS skills and good sense for software architecture
2+ years of industry experience in UX/UI development including hands-on product design, team programming, and experience with building and shipping software products
Strong passion for detailed, innovative, and empathic design, combined with well-rounded design skills (interaction, UI, visual, and motion design)
Excellent spatial sense and a good intuition for the aesthetics and technical aspects of information visualization or cartography
Excellent communiction skills to clearly articulate the reasons behind design decisions
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with frequent releases and tight schedules

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

title: Full Stack Software Developer
description:
Job Description:

DataOne Software (dataonesoftware.com), a Dominion Enterprises company, is seeking a talented, versatile, and entrepreneurial Full-Stack PHP/MySQL/Angular Developer for our Beverly, MA office.

This is an excellent opportunity to join a small, highly productive team and make a meaningful impact. DataOne is an established and successful business, but we have not lost our entrepreneurial spirit and culture. Each of our software developers has a high degree of autonomy, a broad range of responsibilities, and makes direct, valuable contributions to the business. We hire self-motivated professionals who know how to create value, and we work tirelessly to enable and support their success.

We operate a professional development shop. Our team uses GitHub for source control, we have automated deploys, we write automated tests, and we peer review all code before it hits production. We offer a supportive, collaborative environment, superb work-life balance, coaching to help you reach your full potential, and opportunities for career advancement. In return we expect talent, creativity, professionalism, and a strong drive to succeed.

Applicants should have the following:
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent work experience
Some experience programming on your own time (non-academic, non-professional) strongly preferred
Mastery of one or more object-oriented programming languages
Mastery of SQL fundamentals and relational database design concepts
Experience with PHP, HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Experience with Angular or React preferred.
A positive attitude and entrepreneurial spirit
This job may be for you, if:
You're relatively new to Software Development but want serious responsibility and influence
You pay excellent attention to detail
You enjoy solving problems, both independently and collaboratively
You're known for your integrity and professionalism
You value work-life balance
You enjoy weekly team lunches and strong camaraderie
This is a full-time position at our Beverly, MA office, not a freelance / telecommute opportunity. No recruiters, please.

About DataOne Software

For over a decade DataOne Software, a Dominion Enterprises Company, has been creating innovative data and software products that are utilized across the automotive industry.
We are committed to providing a best in class product experience to our customers. Our solutions are used to market, sell, manage and service millions of vehicles throughout
North America. We are also passionate about our employees. We like to think of our corporate culture as offering the best of both worlds, with the positive, can-do approach
of a profitable, fast growing business combined with the backing and security of a large corporate presence. We take pride in maintaining a dynamic and collaborative work
environment where employees can thrive, impact our business and realize their potential.

Dominion Enterprises is an Equal Opportunity Employer and supports Workplace Diversity. Drug Testing Employer.

description:

HMH Software Engineering – Software Engineering

HMH Software Engineering provides cutting edge, individualized learning experiences to millions of students across the United States. We are as driven by this mission as we are by continuously improving ourselves and the way we work. Our offices are high energy, collaborative bee hives of activity where work is centered on small, autonomous teams that build great software. We trust each other, hold ourselves and our teammates accountable for results, and improve student outcomes with each release.

At HMH we constantly experiment with new approaches and novel ways of solving problems. We often succeed and sometimes stumble – either way we learn and move forward with more confidence than we had the day before. We are as passionate about new technologies and engineering craftsmanship as we are about transforming the EdTech industry itself.

We’re not just looking for hands on a keyboard to pound out code, we’re looking for talented teammates and colleagues who contribute as much as they receive and thrive working with us.

Software Engineers personify the notion of constant improvement as they work with their team to build software that delivers on our mission to improve student outcomes. You’re not afraid to try new things even if they don’t work out as expected. You are independent, self-directed, high energy and as eager to contribute to your team as you are to progress on your own path to software craftsmanship. You’ll thrive working in a fast-paced, low friction environment where you’ll be exposed to a wide range of cutting edge technologies.

title: Software Engineer (Software Developer 2)
description:
Stanford University, one of Silicon Valley\'s largest and unique employers, is recruiting an experienced and energetic Software Engineer within the Department of Biomedical Data Science of the School of Medicine. Stanford\'s mission is to educate future leaders and promote interdisciplinary, world-class research and teaching. This passion makes Stanford an intensely creative and rewarding place to work.

This outstanding Software Engineer will assume a leadership role in a large NIH-funded project to create open-source web-based and desktop software to annotate, store, search, and process biomedical images. This exciting work will enable researchers to discover image-based indicators of disease that will transform medical care. The software developed will become part of a national infrastructure supporting biomedical research, and will have high impact throughout the medical community. The Software Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing and documenting the software, working with collaborators and users to understand and implement the requirements, and evaluating and disseminating the software. The successful candidate will be self-directed, thrive in a stimulating collaborative research environment, work well with other developers, and be excited by the opportunity to assume an ownership role in creating software infrastructure that will be adopted by medical centers nationally. The candidate will work closely with faculty, research associates, students, developers, and other collaborators.

Duties include
Conceptualize design, implement, and develop solutions for complex system/programs independently.
Work with a variety of users to gain information, and develop intra-system tradeoffs between different users, as necessary; interact with a diverse client base and outside vendor contacts.

title: Software Developer
description:
Company Description

Xactware, a Verisk business, specializes in technologies for the property insurance, remodeling, restoration, and mortgage and lending industries. Xactware’s tools provide claims estimating, contents replacement, claims management, and property maintenance solutions for desktop, mobile, and online platforms. Xactware’s services include repair cost research and reports, aerial imagery, and real-time business intelligence. Xactware has been providing cloud services for customers since 1995. To learn more about Xactware please visit us at: Xactware.com. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

With a history of impressive growth, an innovative culture, and offering industry-leading solutions, Verisk Analytics is an amazing place to work and make a difference. In 2018, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its World’s Best Employers list and, in 2017, to its World’s Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year. We also earned the Great Place to Work® Certification for the third consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.

Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, energy and specialized markets, and financial services. Using advanced technologies to collect and analyze billions of records, Verisk draws on unique data assets and deep domain expertise to provide first-to-market innovations integrated into customer workflows. We’ve been delivering predictive analytics and decision support solutions to our customers for nearly 50 years, helping them protect people, property, and financial assets. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.

At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.

Job Description

Job Description

We are looking for someone who has a strong web development or computer science background to join a world-class team building the next generation of Xactware’s online claims platform. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of developers, QA analysts, product managers, and designers to build a sophisticated web application. Our team employs a modern technology stack including Angular (6.x), TypeScript, Sass, HTML, ASP.NET Core, and C#. If you know or want to learn these technologies, we’d love to talk with you, so please apply. 

Team Culture & Benefits

· Managers who listen to their employees

· A mindset of continuous improvement. We always want to be getting better.

· 30 minutes a day of personal study time

· On-site gym

· Flexible hours

· Competitive PTO plus 9 holidays a year

· Performance-based yearly bonuses

· A great view of Utah Valley

Essential Functions

· Create cutting-edge software using modern development tools

· Solve non-trivial technical challenges

· Work as a member of a team

· Write unit, integration, and functional tests

· Implement new features and fix bugs

· Contribute to product design

Qualifications

title: Software Developer - Simon Initiative
description:
Carnegie Mellon University’s Simon Initiative accelerates the success of the university’s educational-technology ecosystem. Central to this work is an approach called Learning Engineering: the use of learning research and the affordances of technology to design and deliver innovative, instrumented educational practices. These innovations improve outcomes while simultaneously generating data to refine and advance theory, fueling a virtuous cycle of research and practice. The Initiative encompasses a broad array of faculty, researchers, technologists, expertise centers/organizations, and associated projects, expertise services, technologies, innovations, and research.

We are seeking a front-end software engineer to develop, extend, and scale our web-based learning environment. This is an excellent opportunity if you thrive in an interesting and challenging work environment. The Open Learning Initiative builds rich, interactive, and effective online courses for use in higher education. Join our team and build creative new applications for course authoring, content management, workflow automation, assessment and learning analytics.

Core responsibilities will include:
Design, implement, test and maintain the OLI web-based learning environment. Build scalable solutions using current generation web technologies. Track issues and tasks using bug tracking and project management software. Perform detailed quality assurance testing of all work products. Provide targeted contributions to back-end development as needed.
Analyze feature requests to determine feasibility and system compatibility. Collaborate with software engineers, learning scientists, course developers, domain experts, visual designers and usability specialists to define software requirements.
Support user issues related to the system or application performance and availability. Troubleshoot and resolve problems; communicate resolutions to help desk team.
May need to be on-call during off hours and respond to Tier 2 support issues or system outages.
You should have a team-oriented approach. Adaptability, excellence, and passion are vital qualities within The Simon Initiative. Inclusion, collaboration and cultural sensitivity are valued competencies at CMU. Therefore, we are in search of a team member who is able to effectively interact with a varied population of internal and external partners with a high level of integrity. We are looking for someone who shares our values and who will support the mission of the university through their work.

**Please note this is a fixed term position, dependent on funding and anticipated to last through summer of 2018.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related area required; Master’s degree preferred
One or more years of industry experience building web applications using a modern technology stack, particularly React TypeScript
Additional Skills and Experience:
Strong working knowledge of JavaScript, including fluency in modern language features and third-party type solutions.
Experience applying functional programming techniques to write high-quality, efficient, maintainable code.
Expertise in building web based user interfaces in HTML and CSS.
Familiarity with using Git and GitHub to develop open source software.
Experience in, or desire to learn, Elm.
Experience participating in and facilitating Agile software development.
Experience delivering web applications to tablets, smartphones and other mobile devices.
More Information:

Please visit “Why Carnegie Mellon” to learn more about becoming part of an institution inspiring innovations that change the world.

title: Full-Stack Software Developer
description:
As we build and scale Crystal over the next few years, our product & engineering group is growing along with it. We're building the largest, most accurate personality platform in the world - it's a huge project that requires close collaboration between data analysis, NLP, and social science.

We're looking for a full-stack software engineer to join our team, taking the lead on projects across our platform (web dashboards, integrations, machine learning, etc). We value:
True individual ownership and responsibility over projects.
Saying “no” to lots of good things to say “yes” to one great thing.
Listening to constant feedback from our team and customers.
Having a healthy approach to product velocity and technical debt.
Taking our work very seriously, but not taking ourselves too seriously.
You'll be working alongside a talented product team to translate Crystal's powerful data into everyday business value, and you'll be on the ground floor helping us build the foundation for an enduring, impactful company.

Now for some specifics:
Your day-to-day will vary between different components of our product, so this role requires technical flexibility and a desire to learn new skills quickly. We work primarily with Javascript (React, jQuery), Ruby on Rails, and MySQL. Our platform runs on AWS with services like Elastic Container Service, EC2, RDS, and others.
We have a lot on our roadmap for the next three years, including improvements to the breadth and accuracy of our personality detection system, Chrome extensions, enterprise tools, and data integrations.
We rely on a few tools very heavily for communication and workflow - Slack, Github, Trello, Google Apps.
We love customer support and believe everyone plays a part in user experience.
Requirements

Qualifications:
Sincere appreciation for good communication and healthy work relationships.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Node.JS and React.JS
Experienced with Ruby, Python, Golang or other programming language
Test Driven Development
Experience with Postgres or other SQL databases in a production environment
Writing REST APIs on the back-end, and consuming them on the front-end.
Experience building and maintaining large, complex software products at scale (either consumer or enterprise).
Ability to explain technical concepts to a group clearly and concisely
Nice to have:
Experience with architecting cloud-based deployment strategies and CI workflow, and deployment pipelines
Expertise in AWS, micro-services / server-less architectures, and big data applications
Prior experience with EC2, ECS, and S3 on AWS is beneficial
Things we'd love to see:
One or two products/projects you've developed that you're really proud to show.
Experience with Chrome extensions or other browser integrations.
Benefits

While we are an early stage company and don’t have the same kinds of lavish perks of a larger tech company, we do offer full medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family, flexible hours and a remote-first culture where you’re truly measured on your impact instead of your time.

title: iOS/Android Software Developer
description:
Fearless is looking for an iOS/Android Software Engineer to add to our diverse team of over 75 teammates (and counting!).

 

What you'll be doing:

We're looking to change the world by building software with a soul, and we want your help. On this project, you will be working with 5-7 Fearless team members on a project for one of our existing clients. You will report to the team's Scrum Master, but you will collaborate closely with all members of your Scrum team.

 

What you should know:
This position is located in our headquarters in Baltimore, MD. This position also has the flexibility to support some remote work / telecommuting.
Travel may be required 1-2 times per month.
Why we're excited about you:

We need your mobile development skills! Languages used on this project will include React Native, Android, and iOS.
What other skills will help you succeed at Fearless? Glad you asked! We're excited about candidates who:
Understand development principles, at least one technology stack, and software development tools and processes
Are proficient in troubleshooting and bug fixing
Consistently follows best practices and are able to write correct and clean code without guidance
Work well in a team and know when to ask for help
Can communicate basic technical ideas and concepts to non-technical team members
 

At Fearless, we believe in sharing knowledge, fresh perspectives, and unique interests as individuals and as a company, so we're also interested to know what makes you tick. We want to know where your interests and passions lie so we can all grow together.

 

Compensation:

We believe in paying people fairly, so we've established a compensation model that ensures everyone at Fearless — regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, age, nationality, or negotiation skills — is given equal pay for equal work.

 

So, what's next?

Over the years, we've honed a 3-step interview process that helps ensure that every employee we hire is the right fit for us and that we're the right fit for them. If we think you're a good fit, we'll get in touch and start scheduling your interviews!
Cultural Interview - We're a people-first company, so we always start off by getting to know more about you, how you work, what your career goals are, and what you're passionate about. This is your opportunity to ask questions and get a feel for Fearless, so don't be shy!
Technical Interview - This is where we get into the nitty gritty of the project. During the Technical Interview, you'll be interviewed by our Passion Coaches and/or the team's Project Lead to make sure your skills align with the project requirements.
Business Interview - At this point, you've made it to the final frontier! The Business Interview is when you'll meet with Fearless leadership to dot the i's, cross the t's, and determine whether or not we'll be moving forward with the hiring process.
 

Why Fearless?

Our people make us who we are. We believe that every member of the Fearless team has something to share, and we value the unique viewpoint you'll bring to our community. But we value your community, too, so we offer fulfilling work that stays in balance with the rest of life. Because everyone has different needs, desires, and goals, our benefits offer the choices and flexibility that our team members need to live well and succeed. Here are a few highlights of our benefits package:

 
Flexible schedule
Family-friendly workplace
3 weeks accrued PTO + 1 week sick leave + 10 federal holidays + your birthday off
100% coverage of the employee-only premium for HSA, HMO, or PPO plan and Employee Wellness Plan
Tech, education / training, and snack allowances
Free parking in downtown Baltimore / public transit coverage
Safe Harbor 401(k) plan with employer contributions
 

About Fearless:

Fearless is a full-stack digital services firm in Baltimore that delivers sleek, modern, and user-friendly software designed to push the boundaries of possibility. It's our mission to build software with a soul — tools that empower communities and make a difference — so we can create a world where good software powers the things that matter.

title: Mid-Level Full-Stack Software Developer
description:
Bethesda, MD

RightEye is an exciting, and cutting-edge eye-tracking solutions company and we are looking for qualified candidates for a Mid-Level Full-Stack Software Developer position. The candidate will work with a great team of experts and passionate people. We are looking for an engineer with strong communication skills who is a team player focused on elevating their performance and that of those around them.

Responsibilities Include

Work effectively as part of the engineering team to develop production quality code
Full stack application development
Perform detailed technical design and implementation of features
Actively participate in all aspects of the development methodology and software development lifecycle
Perform code reviews
Mentor others in both coding and software engineering skills
Communicate with technical lead and other team members in order to meet requirements
Contribute to development process/methodology
Effectively manage time and work while reporting status as necessary
Must Have Skills

2+ years of recent Java experience in a professional environment
Experience using Hibernate or another ORM technology
Experience with the Spring ecosystem
Familiarity and comfort working on Frontend Html, Javascript and CSS
Familiarity and practical experience with React, Vue, Angular, JQuery or other javascript frameworks and libraries.
Experience with Maven or Gradle
Other Desired Skills

2+ years of recent Java experience in a professional environment
Experience using Hibernate or another ORM technology
Experience with the Spring ecosystem
Experience with Spring Boot and Spring Security
Familiarity and comfort working on Frontend Html, Javascript and CSS
Familiarity and practical experience with React, Vue, Angular, JQuery or other javascript frameworks and libraries.
Experience with Maven or Gradle
Software development for AWS cloud native applications
Experience building deploying and managing applications in AWS
Experience working with relational databases and preferably some No SLQ database.
Strong understanding of development patterns such as REST and microservices pattern
Familiarity with Docker and containerization
Experience with systems that utilize machine learning
Knowledge and/or experience with HIPAA / PHI requirements
Why RightEye?

Work in an industry segment that is seeing lots of growth
Exciting quick moving company with lots of industry buzz
Entrepreneurial environment that is opportunity and customer driven
Small team work environment
About RightEye

RightEye is the maker of a breakthrough, FDA-cleared eye-tracking technology for general healthcare. This SaaS-based system is proven to uncover vision and brain health issues in minutes. RightEye just surpassed 100,000 patient tests and has a quickly growing customer base. Our product is already used by hundreds of optometrists, medical facilities and professional sports teams (including the Washington Capitals, Nationals and Redskins). RightEye is also a strategic partner with the largest eye-care health company in the United States, with a network of 30,000+ optometrists.

RightEye is gearing up for even faster customer growth. This is your chance to get on the ground floor of one of the regions most cutting-edge and fast-growing B2B technology companies. Recently, RightEye won a coveted Innovations Award at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) and was named Emerging Tech Company of the Year by the Maryland Tech Council.

title: ANALYST - SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT
description:
Job Summary:
Join our Space Science engineering team! Collaborate with a small team of developers to help design and implement overall architecture of web applications, maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications as well as code integrity and organization, aid in implementing security and data protection, and oversee scientific programming for space related data.

Education/Experience:
Requires a BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering with 0-1 year of experience. Must have at least a 3.0 GPA. Must be a skilled full stack web developer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming, developing and designing front end web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of applications and working alongside scientists and engineers for web design features, among other duties. Must have experience with Linux, PHP, HTML, CSS, Python, Javascript, and jQuery. Prefer familiarity with back-end libraries such as CakePHP, experience with front-end class libraries such as Bootstrap, AngularJS, PlotLy, React. Prefer familiarity with developing a site for both mobile and desktop, an understanding of server-side languages including NodeJS, and knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git and SVN. Any experience with GIS, C/C++, and/or other object-oriented languages is highly desirable. Due to the nature of the work (scientific programming for space related data), excellent math skills are also desired. A valid/clear driver's license is required.
